body.name: Kingston 240GB A400 SATA 3 2.5" Internal SSD SA400S37/240G - HDD Replacement for Increase Performance
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 16 hrs 39 mins
features: Fast start up, loading and file transfers
More reliable and durable than a hard drive
Multiple capacities with space for applications or a hard drive replacement
body.description: Incredible speeds plus rock-solid reliability - Kingston's A400 solid-state drive dramatically improves the responsiveness of your existing system with incredible boot, loading and file transfer times compared to mechanical hard drives. Powered by a latest gen controller for read and write speeds up to 500MB/s and 450MB/s, this SSD is 10x faster than a traditional hard drive for higher performance, ultra-responsive multi-tasking and an overall faster system. Also more reliable and durable than a hard drive, A400 is built with Flash memory. There are no moving parts, making it less likely to fail than a mechanical hard drive. It's also cooler and quieter, and its shock and vibration resistance makes it ideal for notebooks and other mobile computing devices. A400 is available in multiple capacities from 120GB-480GB to give you all the space you need for applications, videos, photos and other important documents. You can also replace your hard drive or a smaller SSD with a drive big enough to hold all your files. Backwards compatibility to SATA Rev. 2.0 (3Gb/s) Product contains drive only; cloning software not included. The Vibration operating of this product is 2.17G Peak (7–800Hz) and the Vibration non-operating of this product is 20G Peak (10–2000Hz).

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 10x faster than a hard drive With incredible read/write speeds, the A400 SSD will not only increase performance but can also be used to breathe new life into older systems. Rugged A400 is shock- and vibration-resistant for rugged reliability when used in notebooks and other mobile computing devices. Multiple capacities Available in 120GB, 240GB, 480GB, 960GB and 1.92TB capacities, A400 is designed to suit anyone’s needs.
Ideal for desktops and notebooks A400 has a 7mm form factor to fit in a wider array of systems. It’s ideal for slimmer notebooks and in systems with limited available space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The Kingston 240GB A400 SATA 3 2.5" Internal SSD SA400S37/240G has been a game-changer for me. This remarkable piece of technology breathed new life into my aging computer, serving as the perfect HDD replacement. From the moment I installed it, I noticed a significant boost in performance. My computer now runs smoother and faster, and I couldn't be happier.What sets the Kingston SSD apart is its reliability and affordability. It's a cost-effective solution to upgrade your storage without breaking the bank. The installation process was a breeze, thanks to its user-friendly design. It's compatible with a wide range of devices, making it a versatile choice for anyone looking to enhance their system's performance.The speed and responsiveness of this SSD are truly impressive. Whether I'm booting up my computer or loading large files, it handles everything with ease. I've experienced no lag or slowdowns since I started using it. Plus, the 240GB capacity provides ample space for all my data and applications.In addition to its performance, the Kingston SSD is known for its durability. It's built to withstand the rigors of daily use, ensuring that my data remains safe and secure. I can trust it to store my important files without worry.Overall, the Kingston 240GB A400 SATA 3 2.5" Internal SSD SA400S37/240G has exceeded my expectations in every way. It's a fantastic investment for anyone looking to upgrade their computer's performance without breaking the bank. I love it, and I can't recommend it enough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent product at a reasonable price.
reviews.reviewText: Kingston is a well-known brand in the storage device market, and its SSDs (Solid State Drives) are highly valued for their reliable performance and quality. Kingston SSDs are a popular choice for both home users and professionals looking to improve the performance of their systems and the speed of data access.One of the prominent advantages of Kingston SSDs is their speed. Using flash memory technology and SATA or NVMe interface, these SSDs deliver impressive read and write speeds, resulting in fast operating system boot times, reduced application load times, and a smoother overall experience.In addition to performance, Kingston SSDs are known for their reliability. These devices are designed to withstand vibration, shock, and temperature variations, making them a safe choice for demanding environments or those looking for a durable storage solution.Installing a Kingston SSD is also simple and convenient. Most models are available in 2.5-inch and M.2 formats, allowing for easy integration into desktop computers, laptops, and compact devices.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Big Improvements for the $
reviews.reviewText: PRODUCT: Kingston A400 120GB SSDSUMMARY:This drive is a great deal for improved performance if you don't need a whole lot of space. It’s top-notch for an entry-level SSD, but because of how bare-bones it is, you might need to be prepared for a very slightly more difficult process to set this up than with some other popular SSD choices.MY SITUATION:I’m not precisely an IT professional, but I do deal with all the tech for the small business I work for, and I’d rank my IT skills as medium-high. I'm working on updating the computers in an office with 16 employees, and with most of the computers needing a boost in speed, it's great to be able to buy several of these for a good price. The vast majority of our work documents are stored in shared locations, so none of our computers need a whole lot of space—our staff are generally only using 50-70GB on their drives for the OS and a pretty standard array of programs, so 120GB is the perfect size for us.Because most of our computers are at least three years old, the hardware only supports SATA II, so we're not seeing the huge improvement in speed that we might if we were going from HDDs to upper-limit SATA III speeds, but regardless, speeds have more than doubled in the four computers I've swapped these into so far, and users are seeing improvements, particularly in startup speeds for the computer (from more than 3 minutes down to 30 seconds) and for individual programs. See images for CrystalDisk comparison before and after on one of the machines. I'll post an update once I put together the brand new build I'm about to do with one of these.ISSUES IN THE PROCESS:I did run into a couple of issues that threw me off while installing these. The first was that the drive would not show up after hooking it up in the case and rebooting. It didn’t show in This PC or in Computer Management. The solution was to run Windows Memory Diagnostic, which is easily found through the start menu and took maybe 5-10 minutes to run on the two computers that had this issue. After that, I was able to see the disk in Computer Management, and I GPT partitioned each of the drives from there. See pieced together image for visuals on the process for getting this settled.The other slight hiccup I had was the computer refusing to boot from the drive once I removed the old HDD; this was easily resolved by changing the boot mode in the BIOS from Legacy to UEFI, which was necessary because I had partitioned them all as GPT.OTHER NOTES:I planned on mounting all of these with some heavy-duty Velcro we have lying around the office, which I’ve heard several places is fine because SSDs don’t have moving parts, so they don’t need to be held super-steady, and skipping a mounting bracket saved about $6 per drive (which is nice when buying several). The Velcro is doing just fine for three of the drives, and the fourth computer, conveniently, had a hot-swap bay with a 3.5 slot on one side (where the old HDD was), and a 2.5 spot on the other side that worked perfectly with some spare screws from the last case I bought.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the money, made with reliable components & housed in an aluminum case!
reviews.reviewText: Using it for lubuntu currently for the last few months in an old 2010ish acer aspire one 533, works well with write cache enabled, pretty fast for what it is, very cool running even when loaded down. Seems to be very well made for the money, no cheap plastic case, uses real Kingston flash memory too and more incredibly a phison nand flash controller, most cheap SSD's use some cheap junk from some unknown hongkong special but not this one. Very good value, buy this over that other junk from TeamGroup, pny or even sandisk "excluding their top of the line SanDisk Ultra series, those are actually good" But yes, A Samsung Evo 870 will cream both this in terms of specs and speed, but for the price, it's better than anything else cheaper or the same cost, it is certainly better than an overpriced wd blue ssd drive too and CHEAPER by about 40 bucks. I just got another A400 480gb model on the way to use in another 2009ish netbook, this time, a Compaq c110 mini which has windows 7 on it, tho to get it to run as efficiently and reliably as possible, much like with Linux, you do have to tweak some things if you really wanna be picky like I am., Even without doing anything, I know this drive will still last forever pretty much. These are one of the drives a recommend to all the people I know who want a real product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: it is fast and very useful a good product

Nada como um SSD como este para acelerar o funcionamento de um PC que já estava com uma lentidão insuportável. Perfeito para instalar o Sistema Operacional, tempo de acesso muito bom, muito melhor que um HD normal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Puedes hacer tu pc mucho más rápida si solo cuentas con el puerto SATA
reviews.reviewText: Es la 2da vez que pido este producto y es muy bueno, lo he utilizado para hacer dual boot instalando un sistema operativo en un SSD PCIe y otro sistema en este disco SATA y ambos sistemas cargan muy rápido.También es muy útil si quieres mejorar los tiempos de carga en una consola como el PS4 o si quieres darle una segunda vida a un portátil algo viejo que tarde mucho en cargar el sistema operativo.Es muy fácil de colocar, solo asegurense de que entre bien en su puerto o de colocar bien los tornillos laterales de la carcasa para el disco que suelen traer ciertas laptop o consolas.

Troquei o HD de 1TB mecanico pelo SSD e a velocidade foi espetacular. Tirando o trabalho de reinstalar tudo de novo, a instalação do SSD é bem simples e como é compacto a limitação praticamente são os cabos. Leve e totalmente silencioso. Não percebi aquecimento algum.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Game-Changer for Laptop Speed and Performance
reviews.reviewText: I recently upgraded my laptop by purchasing the Kingston SSD, and the impact on performance has been nothing short of phenomenal. The speed of this SSD is truly remarkable, and it has transformed my computing experience. The improvement is so significant that my laptop now operates at least 10 times faster than before.The most noticeable change is in the speed at which files load and applications open. Tasks that used to take minutes are now completed in a matter of seconds. The overall responsiveness of my laptop has seen a dramatic boost, making multitasking a breeze. I no longer find myself waiting impatiently for files to load or applications to start.One of the most impressive aspects of this Kingston SSD is its lightning-fast boot time. My laptop now starts up in a mere 7 seconds, providing me with instant access to my work and reducing downtime substantially. This has been a game-changer for my productivity, especially when time is of the essence.Beyond the incredible speed, the installation process was straightforward, even for someone with limited technical expertise. The durability and reliability of Kingston as a brand have always been commendable, and this SSD lives up to those standards. In conclusion, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase, and I would highly recommend the Kingston SSD to anyone looking to enhance the performance of their laptop. It's a worthwhile investment that delivers on its promise of speed and efficiency.
Já comprei dois destes os dois notes ficaram excelente, funcionado muito bem há mais de dois anos!
